result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremiah T Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: Concurrent to COUNT 2 and consecutive to case 18CF5707.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 10 MONTHS.

superMiscConds.notes: -Obtain/maintain full time employment/schooling or combination of both.

-Cooperate with agent. 
-Thinking for a change course.
-Provide DNA Sample.

supervisions.notes:
-Restitution set at $0.00.
-Court waives all non-mandatory costs due to inability to pay.
-The court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA and victim/witness surcharge) assessments are to be collected by DOC at MAXIMUM rate from the defendant's prison wages and any other funds and during extended supervision. Any amount due after extended supervision will be due in 36 months; September 15, 2025. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment/tax intercept.

-No contact with firearms.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, body armor, explosives and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Concurrent with: Concurrent to COUNT 1 and consecutive to case 18CF5707.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremiah T Johnson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jeremiah T Johnson in court, in custody.  Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court for Jeremiah T Johnson.  Attorney Erika Strebel in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing. Plea hearing proceeded. Defendant sworn. 

AS TO COUNT 1 AND 2.  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, that a plea of guilty or no contest to the crime you are charged may result in deportation, exclusion from admission to this country, or the denial of naturalization under federal law is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1.  The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 42 MONTHS, concurrent to COUNT 2 and consecutive to case 18CF5707, with credit for 0 days time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 18 MONTHS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 24 MONTHS.
-6 MONTHS revocation of drivers license.

AS TO COUNT 2.  The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 42 MONTHS, concurrent to COUNT 1 and consecutive to case 18CF5707, with credit for 0 days time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 18 MONTHS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 24 MONTHS.

*Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 10 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-No new law violations. 
-Cooperate with agent. 
-Obtain/maintain full time employment/schooling or combination of both.
-Thinking for a change course.
-No contact with firearms.
-Provide DNA Sample.
-Restitution set at $0.00.
-Court waives all non-mandatory costs due to inability to pay.
-The court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA and victim/witness surcharge) assessments are to be collected by DOC at MAXIMUM rate from the defendant's prison wages and any other funds and during extended supervision. Any amount due after extended supervision will be due in 36 months; September 15, 2025. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment/tax intercept.  

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, body armor, explosives and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Plea Questionnaire/ Waiver of Rights.  Received and Filed.  nk
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights.  Received and Filed.  nk
Jury Instructions.  Received and Filed.  nk
Jury Instructions. Received and Filed. nk

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Jeremiah T Johnson not in court, in custody.  
Student Intern Caroline Pellegrini supervised by Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM. Case in court for Scheduling Conference. 
Discussion held.  Defense Counsel request a plea and sentencing hearing date. 
State to do an Order to Produce from Racine  Youthful Offender Correctional Institute. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19. Parties advised this hearing will be held in person, Room 313 of the Safety Building. 
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Darryl Everett Smith in court, defendant Jeremiah T Johnson not in court, in custody.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Alexsandria Carlson. Court waived defendant's appearance.  Defense counsel will be retiring and advised the court that Attorney Mary Garvin-Guimont has been assigned to represent defendant.  Case is adjourned for scheduling.    Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Darryl Everett Smith in court, defendant Jeremiah T Johnson not in court, in custody.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Defense counsel needs to review discovery with the defendant. Defense counsel advised the court that he will be leaving the Public Defenders office. Case will be administratively transfered. Case adjourned for Status of Counsel in branch 45. 
  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Darryl Everett Smith in court, defendant Jeremiah T Johnson not in court, in custody.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense requested an additional scheduling conference date. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jeremiah T Johnson in court with Attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Jeremiah T Johnson in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jeremiah T Johnson in court with attorney Rosemary Cuevas.  Defendant Jeremiah T Johnson in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
